com.ruegnerlukas.simplemath.vectors.quaternion

Interface IQuaternion

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IVector, IVector4
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Quaterniond, Quaternionf

    public interface IQuaternion
extends IVector4

    • Method Summary

      Get the pole of the gimbal lock.

      Multiplies this quaternion with the gigen quanternion (this = this*other)

      Multiplies this quaternion with the given quanternion (this = other*this)

      Converts this quaternion to a float quaternion.

      Creates a new matrix representing this quaternion.

      • setFromAxisAngleDeg

        IQuaternion setFromAxisAngleDeg(IVector4 vec)
        Sets this value of this quaternion to the to the equivalent rotation of the Axis-Angle argument.
        Parameters:
        vec - the axis-angle. x,y,z as the axis and w as the angle in degrees
        Returns:
        this quaternion for chaining

        Returns:
        this quaternion for chaining

      • setFromMatrix

        IQuaternion setFromMatrix(IMatrix mat)
        Sets the component of this quaternion from the given matrix
        Parameters:
        mat - the (rotation) matrix. Must be at least 3x3
        Returns:
        this quaternion for chaining

      • getGimbalPole

        int getGimbalPole()
        Get the pole of the gimbal lock. This quaternion must be normalized.
        Returns:
        +1 for north pole, -1 for south pole, 0 for no gimbal lock

      • getRotationDeg

        IVector3 getRotationDeg()
        Gets the yaw, pitch and roll angle in degrees as a vector. This quaternion must be normalized.
        Returns:
        the vector representing the rotation in degrees of this quaternion

      • getRotationRad

        IVector3 getRotationRad()
        Gets the yaw, pitch and roll angle in radians as a vector. This quaternion must be normalized.
        Returns:
        the vector representing the rotation in radians of this quaternion

      • toRotationMatrix

        IMatrix toRotationMatrix()
        Creates a new matrix representing this quaternion. This quaternion must be normalized.
        Returns:
        the created matrix representing this quaternion.
